title: Khurja Ceramics
hero_image_alt: Colorful glazed ceramic pots from Khurja
short_description: Colorful, glazed dinnerware and decorative items from Khurja, a historic pottery hub in Uttar Pradesh.
long_description:
Khurja, known as the 'Ceramic City', has a pottery tradition dating back over 600 years, influenced by Afghan potters. Today, it is a bustling hub producing glazed stoneware and crockery. 

The distinctive feature of Khurja pottery is its thick slip and vibrant, colorful glazes. While it started with traditional blue pottery styles, it now produces mass-market utility items like tea sets, planters, and dinnerware with floral and modern designs.

major_centres.title: Khurja City
major_centres.summary: Hundreds of factories and emporiums line the streets.

shipping_and_packaging_tips: Heavy. Road transport recommended for bulk.
authenticity_tips: Look for the 'Khurja' stamp on the base.
